columns.name: care_site_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each Care Site.

columns.name: care_site_name
columns.description: The verbatim description or name of the Care Site as in data source

columns.name: place_of_service_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to a Place of Service Concept ID in the Standardized Vocabularies.

columns.name: location_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the geographic Location in the LOCATION table, where the detailed address information is stored.

columns.name: care_site_source_value
columns.description: The identifier for the Care Site in the source data, stored here for reference.

columns.name: place_of_service_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the Place of Service as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

columns.name: concept_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each Concept across all domains.

columns.name: concept_name
columns.description: An unambiguous, meaningful and descriptive name for the Concept.

columns.name: domain_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the [DOMAIN](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/DOMAIN) table the Concept belongs to.

columns.name: vocabulary_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the [VOCABULARY](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/VOCABULARY) table indicating from which source the Concept has been adapted.

columns.name: concept_class_id
columns.description: The attribute or concept class of the Concept. Examples are 'Clinical Drug', 'Ingredient', 'Clinical Finding' etc.

columns.name: standard_concept
columns.description: This flag determines where a Concept is a Standard Concept, i.e. is used in the data, a Classification Concept, or a non-standard Source Concept. The allowables values are 'S' (Standard Concept) and 'C' (Classification Concept), otherwise the content is NULL.

columns.name: concept_code
columns.description: The concept code represents the identifier of the Concept in the source vocabulary, such as SNOMED-CT concept IDs, RxNorm RXCUIs etc. Note that concept codes are not unique across vocabularies.

columns.name: valid_start_date
columns.description: The date when the Concept was first recorded. The default value is 1-Jan-1970, meaning, the Concept has no (known) date of inception.

columns.name: valid_end_date
columns.description: The date when the Concept became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new concept. The default value is 31-Dec-2099, meaning, the Concept is valid until it becomes deprecated.

columns.name: invalid_reason
columns.description: Reason the Concept was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.

columns.name: domain_id
columns.description: A unique key for each domain.

columns.name: domain_name
columns.description: The name describing the Domain, e.g. "Condition", "Procedure", "Measurement" etc.

columns.name: domain_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the [CONCEPT](https://github.com/OHDSI/CommonDataModel/wiki/CONCEPT) table for the unique Domain Concept the Domain record belongs to.

columns.name: location_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each geographic location.

columns.name: address_1
columns.description: The address field 1, typically used for the street address, as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: address_2
columns.description: The address field 2, typically used for additional detail such as buildings, suites, floors, as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: city
columns.description: The city field as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: state
columns.description: The state field as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: zip
columns.description: The zip or postal code.

columns.name: county
columns.description: The county.

columns.name: location_source_value
columns.description: The verbatim information that is used to uniquely identify the location as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: provider_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each Provider.

columns.name: provider_name
columns.description: A description of the Provider.

columns.name: specialty_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to a Standard Specialty Concept ID in the Standardized Vocabularies.

columns.name: care_site_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the main Care Site where the provider is practicing.

columns.name: year_of_birth
columns.description: The year of birth of the Provider.

columns.name: gender_concept_id
columns.description: The gender of the Provider.

columns.name: provider_source_value
columns.description: The identifier used for the Provider in the source data, stored here for reference.

columns.name: specialty_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the Provider specialty as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

columns.name: specialty_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

columns.name: gender_source_value
columns.description: The gender code for the Provider as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.

columns.name: gender_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

columns.name: vocabulary_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each Vocabulary, such as ICD9CM, SNOMED, Visit.

columns.name: vocabulary_name
columns.description: The name describing the vocabulary, for example "International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification, Volume 1 and 2 (NCHS)" etc.

columns.name: vocabulary_reference
columns.description: External reference to documentation or available download of the about the vocabulary.

columns.name: vocabulary_version
columns.description: Version of the Vocabulary as indicated in the source.

columns.name: vocabulary_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the CONCEPT table for the Vocabulary the VOCABULARY record belongs to.

columns.name: condition_occurrence_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each Condition Occurrence event.

columns.name: person_id
columns.description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is experiencing the condition. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

columns.name: condition_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Condition Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

columns.name: condition_start_date
columns.description: The date when the instance of the Condition is recorded.

columns.name: condition_start_datetime
columns.description: The date and time when the instance of the Condition is recorded.

columns.name: condition_end_date
columns.description: The date when the instance of the Condition is considered to have ended.

columns.name: condition_end_datetime
columns.description: The date when the instance of the Condition is considered to have ended.

columns.name: condition_type_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the source data from which the condition was recorded, the level of standardization, and the type of occurrence.

columns.name: stop_reason
columns.description: The reason that the condition was no longer present, as indicated in the source data.

columns.name: provider_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the Provider in the PROVIDER table who was responsible for capturing (diagnosing) the Condition.

columns.name: visit_occurrence_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table during which the Condition was determined (diagnosed).

columns.name: condition_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the condition as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard condition concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

columns.name: condition_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to a Condition Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

columns.name: condition_status_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the condition status as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: condition_status_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standard Vocabulary reflecting the condition status

columns.name: person_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each person.

columns.name: gender_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique gender of the person.

columns.name: year_of_birth
columns.description: The year of birth of the person. For data sources with date of birth, the year is extracted. For data sources where the year of birth is not available, the approximate year of birth is derived based on any age group categorization available.

columns.name: month_of_birth
columns.description: The month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the month is extracted and stored in this field.

columns.name: day_of_birth
columns.description: The day of the month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the day is extracted and stored in this field.

columns.name: birth_datetime
columns.description: The date and time of birth of the person.

columns.name: race_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique race of the person.

columns.name: ethnicity_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to the standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the ethnicity of the person.

columns.name: location_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the place of residency for the person in the location table, where the detailed address information is stored.

columns.name: provider_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the primary care provider the person is seeing in the provider table.

columns.name: care_site_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the site of primary care in the care_site table, where the details of the care site are stored.

columns.name: person_source_value
columns.description: An (encrypted) key derived from the person identifier in the source data. This is necessary when a use case requires a link back to the person data at the source dataset.

columns.name: gender_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the gender of the person as it appears in the source data. The person’s gender is mapped to a standard gender concept in the Standardized Vocabularies; the original value is stored here for reference.

columns.name: gender_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the gender concept that refers to the code used in the source.

columns.name: race_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the race of the person as it appears in the source data. The person race is mapped to a standard race concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original value is stored here for reference.

columns.name: race_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the race concept that refers to the code used in the source.

columns.name: ethnicity_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the ethnicity of the person as it appears in the source data. The person ethnicity is mapped to a standard ethnicity concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.

columns.name: ethnicity_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the ethnicity concept that refers to the code used in the source.

columns.name: visit_occurrence_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each Person's visit or encounter at a healthcare provider.

columns.name: person_id
columns.description: A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the visit is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

columns.name: visit_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key that refers to a visit Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.

columns.name: visit_start_date
columns.description: The start date of the visit.

columns.name: visit_start_datetime
columns.description: The date and time of the visit started.

columns.name: visit_end_date
columns.description: The end date of the visit. If this is a one-day visit the end date should match the start date.

columns.name: visit_end_datetime
columns.description: The date and time of the visit end.

columns.name: visit_type_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of source data from which the visit record is derived.

columns.name: provider_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was associated with the visit.

columns.name: care_site_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the care site in the care site table that was visited.

columns.name: visit_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the visit as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: visit_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

columns.name: admitting_source_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the Place of Service Vocabulary reflecting the admitting source for a visit.

columns.name: admitting_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the admitting source as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: discharge_to_concept_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the Place of Service Vocabulary reflecting the discharge disposition for a visit.

columns.name: discharge_to_source_value
columns.description: The source code for the discharge disposition as it appears in the source data.

columns.name: preceding_visit_occurrence_id
columns.description: A foreign key to the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table of the visit immediately preceding this visit
